page.title: 03GARSDON FARMING
page.content: On the farm where my Dad works crops are important because there are three fields of rape also corn, wheat and grassland. Some young cows are on the grasslands. There is plenty of grassland for cows to feed on. The older cows go away when they are fat. They get killed and are used for beef. In the summer, silage is made and Dad is busy hay making. He has a round baler. The straw goes up into the baler, gets twirled around,then string lets the straw go around and it twists together. The big round bale comes out of the back. It just carries on like that. My Dad and I go out each morning to check that the cows are all well. Other farms in this area do have milking herds.
